rComments: This professor is extremely arrogant. Said in lecture class the other day that he could tell which students were more intelligent than others. As a professor, he should be trying to encourage students rather than bring them down. Lots of work for this class as a seminar and only sees things his way. Interesting class, but dislike the professor

Great professor! Test were not so hard but they do involve lots of writing. Make sure to read the read the articles and book there are questions from them on test. Make sure to attend class you may miss important notes and he does not post them online. Over all i love the  class and if your interest in children psychopathology i really recommend.
Very helpful, loved the mid-term topics and assignments. Very useful and interesting information. Great professor.

The material is interesting and Saposnek is extremely knowledgeable. However, if you care about your GPA, do not take this class. He tests you on minor details from the different versions of DSM, and has you write a paper that is a SCREENPLAY about a dysfunctional family. Incredibly bizarre expectations. Only PSYC class I've ever gotten a C in.

In "Psychology of Children & Divorce" Don Saposnek did an excellent job.  He is open to suggestions, and is a fair grader. He pretty much wrote the book on mediation, so he knows his stuff.  The midterm was based off four books, which needed to be read, and the final was an oral presentation/paper.  Overall excellent professor with a heart of gold.

If you plan on becoming a clinical psychologist you NEED to take his class. He creates a clear understanding of what the field is truly like and is well aware of the bullsh*t of the field yet the strange benefits that bullsh*t can have. An extremely good teacher and not a bad song writer as well. :-P

Saposnek is amazing. His class was always entertaining, regardless of interest in the subject-matter. He has a great sense of humor and is very clear and concise. Go to EVERY CLASS, your notes will help you more on mid-terms/finals than the textbook and eRes readings combined. It's not easy, but if it interests you it's incredibly rewarding and fun

If you plan on or are considering working with children, you should take this course. Very interesting, a great learning experience. Fun lectures, extremely knowledgeable and easy to talk to (c'mon, the guy's a shrink!). Heavy reading, but most of it is interesting. Fun, creative paper on how to create deviant kids.

The TA is the grader, so get to know him or her.  The prof. is great and interesting.  The only problem with this guy is that he thinks that class is a time for him to talk politics.  Don't openly disagree with any of his political opinions cause he does not like it.  Easy B

Not an easy teacher, but amazing. I learned so much from his class. He presents material in a clear way then has you do something (in class skit, paper, etc.) that makes you fully understand him. If you are interested in Child and Family Therapy and Psychology, you should take this course!
This was a great class-he's very enthusiastic about the subject matter and very entertaining with his presentation of the material.  He's one of the best professors I've had.
Awesome psychology teacher with a great grasp of the material, it's a shame he doesn't teach more courses. If you're interested in a good personality psych course, definitely take this class.

This class was the best class that I have ever taken.  This class will determine if you like Clinical Child Psychology or not.  There is a lot of reading, but the lectures are so awesome.  Dr. Saposnek integrates in-class demonstrations of different types of therapies.  A great class, and I advise everyone to take it.  Not a slacker course!
